doc.description:
Doublet maneuver for system itentification.
The module is used by including the module in the airframe file and adding the following line to the <command_laws> section:
<call fun="sys_id_doublet_add_values(autopilot_get_motors_on(),FALSE,values)"/>
You can pick the axes to apply doublet to by setting the DOUBLET_AXES variable with the COMMAND_XXX variables where XXX are the actuators defined in the <commands> section of your airframe.
Then, the GCS exposes the settings for the doublet. - The doublet axis settings is the index (0-based) of the axis to choose within the DOUBLET_AXES variable specified. In the default, this means i.e. 0 means roll doublet. - Amplitude is the amplitude of the doublet - Length_s is the length in seconds of the doublet
Start the doublet by pressing the "Doublet start" button in the strip. Pressing "Doublet stop" will instantly stop doublet.
Add the message "DOUBLET" to your telemetry to see doublet progress, and to your logger to automatically filter doublets in post-processing.

define.name: DOUBLET_AXES
define.description: Which axes the doublet is applied to (specify as array with {})

define.name: DOUBLET_ENABLED
define.description: If false, the doublet does not run and values are not added
